content: I can’t repeat it enough to all my friends: yes, meditation delivers plenty of results. But, unlike mostly anything else we learn in this place, time, society, and cultural environment we live in, is that the irony of it is: “don’t do it because of the results — don’t chase any goals. Do it just for the sake of doing it. No expectations. Breath, meditate, and be there, just that.” Your relation with the outcomes of meditation is like that with a butterfly: the more you chase it, the more it goes away from you — look elsewhere, direct your focus to anything else (hint: your breathing) and before you know it, the butterfly comes to you by itself and sits right on your shoulder.
